title: Hydrogen
author: Hydrogen
content: What are the best crypto communities and forums on the internet, other than bitcointalk?Are there good coding resources to refine basic knowledge of crypto algorithmic functions?Share the wealth.

comments.author: Ucy
comments.body: Quote from: Hydrogen on October 13, 2023, 11:12:29 AMWhat are the best crypto communities and forums on the internet, other than bitcointalk?Are there good coding resources to refine basic knowledge of crypto algorithmic functions?Share the wealth.As far as I can tell, there are no good crypto communities anywhere in Cryptospace. To be good, a community has to operate, work = solve problems with little to no issue.  Such is not possible with people who do not completely depend on their CREATOR. But you may be lucky to find a community/forum ranked above normal World's standards. It would need to have very principled people who try as much as possible to operate or build things according to Bitcoin ideals.Imagine a transparent forum where anyone is free to join with little-no permission, the forum has fair rules, members can be anonymous,  can have unlimited account derived from their main accounts, no one is trusted.. as the trustworthiness/authenticity of everything is proven before it's accepted, the state of any public post before it's changed is immutable, merit & reputation based grading allowing all contributions/deeds to go through compulsory grading, the best members lead via merit based ranking, has a deflationary currency, has marketplaces for interdependent economic system, has different offices/departments for people or groups of people with special talents/skills, the forum leaders bring  talented people together to build great/good things, job is always available, workers are paid according to how well their works are done, etc I think such a community or forum could operate as a parallel society based both in cyberspace and physical world.
